flawed_nl_solution:
Peter has 19 - 7 = <<19-7=9>>9 years of experience.
Robert has 9 - 4 = <<9-4=5>>5 years of experience.
Mike has 5 - 2 = <<5-2=3>>3 years of experience.
Tom has 2 * 5 = <<2*5=10>>10 years of experience.
Roger has 9 + 5 + 3 + 10 = <<9+5+3+10=27>>27 years of experience.
Roger has to work another 50 - 27 = <<50-27=23>>23 years before he retires.
#### 23

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 9. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
